Package sample

Class LogINpanelController

java.lang.Object
sample.LogINpanelController
Direct Known Subclasses:
AddNewDonationController, AdminPanelController, ChangePasswordController, DonationInfoController, DoneePanelController, DoneePrevReqController, DonorApprovalListController, DonorInfoController, DonorPanelController, OrganizationDonorPanelController, OrganizationPanelController, OrgApprovalListController, OrgLicInfoController, ShowDetailDonationInfoController, UserPanelController
public class LogINpanelController
extends java.lang.Object
This Class Controllers the sample.LogINpanel.fxml file. Handles the Log in of the users through fecthing the credentials.

  • Method Details

    • getType

      public static java.lang.String getType()
      Getter function for the type, explicitly mentioned for optimization. Not needed to parse through the whole user table because of this. Static Method.
      Returns:
      String, type of the user.

    • getUser

      public static java.lang.String getUser()
      Getter function of the User, static method
      Returns:
      String, which is the user name.

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      This is the initializing function of the fxml components. When a the window is launched this method initializes these components. Establishes the connection with the database and upon fetching the data columns works with the property values.

    • checkCredentials

      public boolean checkCredentials()
      Method for checking the credentials given input. The Credentials are taken and query is generated accordingly. Then the database is accessed to see the existence of a user. No Null entries are possible here in the relations.
      Returns:
      boolean, true of credentials match Catch block used for the catching og of different possible exceptions in runtime or false otherwise.

    • pressLogIN

      public void pressLogIN​(javafx.event.ActionEvent even) throws java.io.IOException
      This method is for the "Log IN" button in the Log in Panel. The upon checking valid credentials this will show a confirmation window or show error.
      Parameters:
      even - an Object of the ActionEvent Class
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - which is a checked exception. Used to identify errors in i/p and o/p of a particular workflow.

    • pressRegister

      public void pressRegister​(javafx.event.ActionEvent even) throws java.io.IOException
      This is the method for the Register button on the Log In Panel. This laods the sample.Register.fxml and presents the form of registration with appropriate fields.
      Parameters:
      even - an Object of the ActionEvent Class
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - which is a checked exception. Used to identify errors in i/p and o/p of a particular workflow.

    • pressBack

      public void pressBack​(javafx.event.ActionEvent even) throws java.io.IOException
      This method is here for the functionality of the "Back" button. This will redirect the user to the parent node that is the "root" which is sample.UserPanel.fxml. This hierarchical structure is for the simplicity of the system.
      Parameters:
      even - which is an object of ActionEvent Class refers to the event of action for the method
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - which is a checked exception. Used to identify errors in i/p and o/p of a particular workflow.
